sourceDesc.p: The contents of this document are generated from SOSOL.

revisionDesc.change: Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - line 25: "what it is like to work on something" -> should become -> "what it is like to supply something"
Vote - AcceptWithModification - Question: in the translation the word 'supply' of the edition was changed into 'work on'. This may be based on a change of mind by the author, so perhaps let it pass?

p.note: No translation provided by the edition

div.p: [...] having withdrawn (them) from the work so that 10 persons and [...] bronze [...] I gave him 100 dr. from the bank near the Labyrinth and he is busy cutting the reed, and he will bring [it] tomorrow on the basis of the contracts/receipts, so that you may know what it is like to supply something none of which is bundled up – as is the case here [...]. I know perfectly [that ...] once you having written the contract/receipt [the work] will be protracted so that it not [...] be dissolved. Translation: B. Van Beek in P.Petr.Kleon, p. 239, © Peeters

listBibl.bibl: B. Van Beek in P.Petr.Kleon, p. 239, © Peeters
